description: First past the post (FPTP) is the voting system used by most of the U.S.
And the candidate with the most votes wins.
This voting system encourages a two-party system, polarized candidates, and vote-splitting, and disincentives convincing voters outside your party to vote for you.
Let's take a closer look at how FPTP encourages a polarized, two-party system.
Ranked Choice Voting (RCV) is an alternative voting method used in Australia, ..., as well as in the US in California, Maine, etc.
Every voter ranks their preferences for candidates.
